thread.title: Oil futures settle with a weekly loss of nearly 5%
thread.title_full: Oil futures settle with a weekly loss of nearly 5% - MarketWatch

author: Myra P. Saefong
title: Oil futures settle with a weekly loss of nearly 5%
text:
Oil futures settled lower Friday , down 4.8% on the week, pressured by a weekly rise in the number of active U.S. oil rigs and worries about a slowdown in energy demand spurred by losses in Chinese and U.S. stock markets. Oct. crude CLZ5, -2.63% dropped 87 cents, or 2.1%, to settle at $40.45 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices based on the most-active contracts have now fallen for 8 weeks in a row, their longest weekly losing streak since 1986, according to FactSet data. Gasoline futures, meanwhile, turned higher following news of fire at a refinery in Delaware. Sept. gasoline RBU5, +0.97% added a penny to settle at $1.545 a gallon, but it was still down 8.4% for the week.
Read the full story: Oil suffers longest weekly losing streak since 1986
